issue.title: [Java] Read and write record batches to shared memory
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-721](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-721). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It would be useful for a Java application to be able to read a record batch as a set of memory mapped byte buffers given a file name and a memory address for the metadata.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-721?focusedCommentId=16761420) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I think this is still an important use case.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-721?focusedCommentId=16833771) by Ji Liu (tianchen92):*
`[~wesmckinn]`  Could you give some more detailed description for this issue？Do you mean that add APIs to write ArrowRecordBatch to byte array and read it？

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-721?focusedCommentId=16833860) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This would mean reading Arrow IPC messages from a memory-map without copying. I think the work to partly enable this to be built is being done in ARROW-3191

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-721?focusedCommentId=16845929) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
`[~siddteotia]` is this something of interest for the next release to validate the new Java capabilities?
